Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a course offered on the LearnNova platform.

description.description: Brief description of the course content.

duration.description: The duration of the course (e.g., '3 months').

icon.description: Icon associated with the course (e.g., graduation cap, microscope).

definition.description: Stores course information. Each document represents a course offered on the LearnNova platform.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to store course data. A top-level `courses` collection stores course information. This structure is simple and scalable for future enhancements.

**Authorization Independence:** Since there are no explicit authorization requirements mentioned in the prompt (e.g., user-specific courses, collaborative courses), the structure doesn't require denormalization for authorization. If, in the future, courses need to be owned by users or have specific access controls, the `Course` documents will need to denormalize relevant authorization data.

**QAPs:**
*   The segregation of course data into a single collection (`courses`) ensures that all documents share the same security requirements. This simplifies the security rules and ensures that listing courses can be done securely.
*   If user-specific data is added later, path-based ownership or membership maps will be used to provide Authorization Independence and enable secure listing of user-specific data.
